trans-unit.source: Represents an MSBuild project, a targets file, or any other file that conforms to MSBuild project file schema.
This class and its related classes allow a complete MSBuild project or targets file to be read and written.
Comments and white space cannot be edited through this model at present.
Each project root element is associated with exactly one project collection.
This allows the owner of that project collection to control its lifetime and not be surprised by edits that come from another project collection.
Adds a project import to this project.
If import groups exist, inserts the project import into the last import group that has no Condition attribute; otherwise, creates an import at the end of the project.
The project to be imported.
Returns the added project import.
Creates an import group at the end of this project.
This convenience method picks a location in the MSBuild DOM based on a heuristic.
Returns the import group created at the end of this project.
Adds an item to this project.
Creates an item, then adds it to an item group with no Condition attribute and at least one item of same item type.
If no such item group is found, creates a new item group and adds the item to it.
Items are ordered by Include values.
Does nothing if the item matches an existing wildcard expression for this item type.
The item type of the item to be added.
The Include value of the item to be added.
Returns the added item.
Adds an item with metadata to this project.
Creates an item, then adds it to an item group with no Condition attribute and at least one item of same item type.
If no such item group is found, creates a new item group and adds the item to it.
Items are ordered by Include values.
The item type of the item to be added.
The Include value of the item to be added.
The metadata to be added.
Returns the added item.
Adds an item definition to this project.
Creates an item, then adds it to an item group with no Condition attribute and at least one item of same item type.
If no such item group is found, creates a new item group and adds the item to it.
Items are ordered by Include values.
The item type of the item definition to be added.
Returns the added item definition.
Adds an item definition group to this project.
Creates and adds an item definition group after the last existing item definition group, if any.
Otherwise, creates an item definition group after the last existing property group, if any.
If no property group exists, creates a new item definition group at the end of the project.
Returns the added item definition group.
Creates and adds an item group to this project.
Creates and adds an item group after the last existing item group, if any.
Otherwise, creates an item group after the last existing property group, if any.
If no property group exists, creates a new item group at the end of the project.
Returns the added item group.
Updates or adds a property to this project.
Updates the last existing property with the specified `name` that has no Condition attribute on itself or on the property group that contains it.
Otherwise, creates a property and adds it to the first property group that has no Condition attribute.
If no such property group exists, creates a property group after the last existing property group, if any, and adds the property to it .
Otherwise, creates and adds a property group to the start of the project, and adds the property to it.
The name of the property to be updated or added.
The value of the property to be updated or added.
Returns the updated or added property.
Adds a new property group to this project.
Creates a property group and adds it after the last existing property group, if any.
Otherwise, adds the property group to the start of the project.
Returns the added property group.
Adds a target to the project.
Convenience method that picks a location based on a heuristic: Creates a target at the end of the project.
The name of the target to be added.
Returns the added target.
Adds a [UsingTask Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/20247902-9446-4a1f-8253-5c7a17e4fe43) to the project.
Either the `assemblyName` or `assemblyFile` must be null, but not both.
The task name.
The file path to the assembly.
The name of the assembly to load.
Returns the added UsingTask element.
Gets all child [Choose Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7b8b025a-d944-4f5c-9018-c89fc2ef146d) in this project.
Returns all child Choose elements.
Gets null because the Condition attribute is nonexistent for this element and a nonexistent condition is implicitly true.
Returns a null.
Do not use.
The Condition attribute is nonexistent for <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement"></xref>.
Get throws an internal error.
Throws an internal error and returns null.
Creates and initializes an in-memory, empty ProjectRootElement instance and adds it to the global project collection.
Returns the new project root.
Creates and initializes an in-memory, empty ProjectRootElement instance and adds it to the specified project collection.
The project collection to be added to.
Returns the new project root.
Creates and initializes an in-memory, empty ProjectRootElement instance and adds it to the global project collection.
The new project root is initialized from data found at the specified file path.
The file path to the data used for initialization.
Returns the new project root.
Creates and initializes an in-memory, empty ProjectRootElement instance and adds it to the global project collection.
The new project root is initialized from data read from the specified XmlReader.
May throw InvalidProjectFileException.
The XML reader used for initialization.
Returns the new project root.
Creates and initializes an in-memory, empty ProjectRootElement instance and adds it to the specified project collection.
The new project root is initialized from data found at the specified file path.
The file path to the data used for initialization.
The project collection to be added to.
Returns the new project root.
Creates and initializes an in-memory, empty ProjectRootElement instance and adds it to the specified project collection.
The new project root is initialized from data read from the specified XmlReader.
May throw InvalidProjectFileException.
The XML reader used for initialization.
The project collection to be added to.
Returns the new project root.
Creates a [Choose Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7b8b025a-d944-4f5c-9018-c89fc2ef146d).
Caller must add the Choose element to the location of choice in the project.
A <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectChooseElement"></xref> object.
Creates an [Import Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3bfecaf1-69fd-4008-b651-c9dafd4389d9).
Caller must add the Import element to the location of choice in the project.
The project to be imported.
Returns the created Import element.
Creates an import group.
Caller must add the import group to the location of choice in the project.
Returns the import group.
Creates an item definition.
Caller must add the item definition to the location of choice in the project.
The item type of the item definition.
Returns the item definition.
Creates an item definition group.
Caller must add the item definition group to the location of choice in the project.
Returns the item definition group.
Creates an item.
Caller must add the item to the location of choice in the project.
The item type of the item.
Returns the item.
Creates an item with the specifed Include value.
Caller must add the item to the location of choice in the project.
The item type of the item.
The Include value of the item.
Returns the item.
Creates an item group.
Caller must add the item group to the location of choice in the project.
Returns the item group.
Creates a metadata node with the specified name.
Caller must add the metadata node to the location of choice in the project.
The name of the metadata.
Returns the metadata node.
Creates a metadata node with the specified name and value.
Caller must add the metadata node to the location of choice in the project.
The name of the metadata.
The value of the metadata.
Returns the metadata element.
Creates an [OnError Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/765767d3-ecb7-4cd9-ba1e-d9468964dddc).
Caller must add the OnError element to the location of choice in the project.
The targets to execute if a task fails.
Returns the OnError element.
Creates an [Otherwise Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/de3997e9-1595-4263-a886-95530b56a319).
Caller must add it to the location of choice in the project.
Caller must add the Otherwise element to the location of choice in the project.
Returns the Otherwise element.
Creates an [Output Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/34bc7cd1-efd3-4b57-b691-4584eeb6a0e9).
Caller must add the Output element to the location of choice in the project.
Either itemType or propertyName must be specified, but not both.
The name of the task's output parameter.
The item that receives the task's output parameter value.
The property that receives the task's output parameter value.
Returns the Output element.
Creates a [ProjectExtensions Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f95f312f-ff92-41eb-9469-ad99e236a307).
Caller must add the ProjectExtensions element to the location of choice in the project.
Returns the ProjectExtensions element.
Creates a property.
Caller must add the property to the location of choice in the project.
The name of the property.
Returns the property.
Creates a property group.
Caller must add the property group to the location of choice in the project.
Returns the property group.
Creates a target.
Caller must add the target to the location of choice in this project.
The name of the target.
Returns the target.
Creates a task.
Caller must add the task to the location of choice in this project.
The name of the task.
Returns the task.
Creates a task to be referenced by a [UsingTask Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/20247902-9446-4a1f-8253-5c7a17e4fe43).
Caller must add the task to the UsingTask element of choice in the project.
The string to evaluate.
The body to add.
Returns the task.
Adds a [UsingTask Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/20247902-9446-4a1f-8253-5c7a17e4fe43) to the project.
Caller must add the UsingTask element to the location of choice in the project.
Either the `assemblyName` or `assemblyFile` must be null, but not both.
The task name.
The file path to the assembly.
The name of the assembly to load.
Returns the UsingTask element.
Adds a [UsingTask Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/20247902-9446-4a1f-8253-5c7a17e4fe43) to the project.
Caller must add the UsingTask element to the location of choice in the project.
Either the `assemblyName` or `assemblyFile` must be null, but not both.
Both the `runtime` and `architecture` can be null.
The task name.
The file path to the assembly.
The name of the assembly to load.
Optional runtime specifier.
Optional architecture specifier.
Returns the UsingTask element.
Creates a parameter for use in a [UsingTask Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/20247902-9446-4a1f-8253-5c7a17e4fe43) parameter group.
Caller must add the parameter to the UsingTask parameter group of choice in the project.
The name of the UsingTask element.
Stores outputs from the task in the project file.
A user-defined task parameter that contains the parameter value as its value.
The type of the parameter.
Returns the parameter.
Creates a parameter group for a [UsingTask Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/20247902-9446-4a1f-8253-5c7a17e4fe43).
Caller must add the parameter group to the UsingTask element of choice in the project.
Returns the parameter group.
Creates a [When Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/eb27de6f-4e71-4e87-87e2-d93f7bf5899c) with a specified Condition attribute.
Caller must add the When element to the location of choice in this project.
The value of the Condition attribute.
Returns the When element.
Gets or sets the value of the DefaultTargets attribute.
Removes the DefaultTargets attribute if the value to set is an empty string or null.
Returns the value of the DefaultTargets attribute.
Returns an empty string if the attribute is not present.
Location of the DefaultTargets attribute on this element, if any.
May not be correct if file is not saved, or file has been edited since it was last saved.
Returns the DefaultTargets attribute location.
If there is no such attribute, returns null.
Gets the directory path to the project file.
This method is required for evaluating relative paths.
Returns the directory path, which is never null.
If the project is not loaded from disk, returns the current-directory at the time the project was loaded.
Specifies the character encoding that the project file is to be saved in.
Returns the encoding given by the Xml declaration in the project file.
If no encoding is specified, this defaults to UTF 8.
Returns the character encoding that the project file is to be saved in.
Gets the full path to the project file.
Returns the full path to the project file.
If the project is not loaded from disk, returns null.
Determines whether the project has been modified since it was last loaded or saved.
Returns true if the project has been modified; false otherwise.
Gets all the child import groups in this project.
Returns all the child import groups in this project.
Gets all the child import groups in this project, starting with the last group.
Returns all the child import groups in this project, starting with the last group.
Gets all the child import elements in this project.
Gets all the child import elements in this project.
Gets or sets the value of the InitialTargets attribute.
Removes the InitialTargets attribute if the value to set is an empty string or null.
Returns the InitialTargets attribute value.
Returns an empty string if the attribute is not present.
Location of the InitialTargets attribute on this element, if any.
Returns InitialTargets attribute location.
If there is no such attribute, returns null.
Gets all the child item definition groups in this project.
Returns all the child item definition groups in this project.
Gets all the child item definition groups in this project, starting with the last group.
Returns all the child item definition groups in this project, starting with the last group.
Gets all child item definitions in all item definition groups anywhere in this project.
Gets all child item definitions in all item definition groups anywhere in this project.
Gets all the child item groups in this project.
Does not include any item groups contained by Choose elements.
Returns all the child item groups in this project.
Gets all the child item groups present in this project, starting with the last group.
Does not include any item groups contained by Choose elements.
Returns all the child item groups present in this project, starting with the last group.
Gets all child items in this project.
Returns all child items in this project, even if they are contained by Choose elements.
Gets the last-write-time of the project file.
This property can be used to determine whether a file has been changed on disk by a process other than the MSBuild process.
Gets the last-write-time of the project file.
Initializes a project root in the specified project collection by loading data from the specified file path.
May throw InvalidProjectFileException.
The file path to the data.
The project collection containing the project to be initialized.
Returns the initialized project root.
Initializes a project root in the global project collection by loading data from the specified file path.
May throw InvalidProjectFileException.
The file path to the data.
Returns the initialized project root.
The location of the originating file itself, not any specific content within it.
If the file has not been given a name, this is an empty location.
This is a legitimate case of having no location.
Returns the originating file location or an empty location.
Gets all the child properties in this project.
Returns all child properties in this project, even if they are contained by Choose elements.
Gets all the child property groups in this project.
Does not include any item groups contained by Choose elements.
Returns all the child property groups in this project.
Gets all the child property groups present in this project, starting with the last group.
Does not include any item groups contained by Choose elements.
Returns all the child property groups present in this project, starting with the last group.
Gets the XML content that represents this project.
Does not mark the content as unmodified.
The MSBuild object model provides no other way to access the XML content.
Returns the XML content that represents this project as a string.
Saves the project, if modified, using the specified character encoding.
Marks the project as unmodified.
The character encoding used to save the project.
Saves the project, if modified or if the file path to storage has changed.
Marks the project as unmodified.
The file path to the project in storage.
Saves the project, if modified or if the file path to storage has changed.
Uses the specified character encoding..
Marks the project as unmodified.
The file path to the project in storage.
The character encoding used to save the project.
Saves the project, if modified, to the file system.
Uses the character Encoding returned by the Encoding property.
Marks the project as unmodified.
Saves the project to the specified text writer, whether modified or not.
Uses the character encoding of the TextWriter.
Marks the project as unmodified.
The text writer to write the project to.
Gets all the child targets in this project.
Returns all the child targets in this project.
Gets the time that this project was last modified.
Returns the time that this project was last modified.
Returns null if the project hasn't been modified since being created or loaded.
Gets or sets the value of the ToolsVersion attribute.
Removes the ToolsVersion attribute if the value to set is an empty string or null.
Returns the ToolsVersion attribute value.
Returns an empty string if the attribute is not present.
The location of the ToolsVersion attribute on this element, if any.
Returns the ToolsVersion attribute location.
If there is no such attribute, returns null.
Gets or sets the value of the TreatAsLocalProperty attribute.
Removes the TreatAsLocalProperty attribute if the value to set is an empty string or null.

For more information about the `TreatAsLocalProperty` attribute, see [Project Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d1cda56a-dbef-4109-9201-39e962e3f653) and [How to: Build the Same Source Files with Different Options](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d14f1212-ddd9-434f-b138-f840011b0fb2).
Returns the TreatAsLocalProperty attribute value.
Returns an empty string if the attribute is not present.
The location of the TreatAsLocalProperty attribute on this element, if any.
Returns the TreatAsLocalProperty attribute location.
If there is no such attribute, returns null.
Gets the project root in the global project collection that was loaded into memory from the specified file path.
or null if it is not currently in memory.
It is possible for ProjectRootElements to be brought into memory and discarded due to memory pressure.
If TryOpen returns null it does not indicate that the project root has never been loaded, only that it is not currently in memory.
The path of the ProjectRootElement, cannot be null.
Returns the project root.
Returns null if no project was loaded into memory from the specified file path.
Gets the project root in the specified project collection that was loaded into memory from the specified file path.
or null if it is not currently in memory.
It is possible for ProjectRootElements to be brought into memory and discarded due to memory pressure.
If TryOpen returns null it does not indicate that the project root has never been loaded, only that it is not currently in memory.
The path of the ProjectRootElement, cannot be null.
The project collection to search for the project root.
Returns the project root.
Returns null if no project was loaded into memory from the specified file path.
Gets all child [UsingTask Element (MSBuild)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/20247902-9446-4a1f-8253-5c7a17e4fe43) in this project.
Returns all child UsingTask elements in this project.
Gets the version number of this object.
Compare this version number to a stored version number to determine whether the project XML content has changed, even if the project is saved after the change.
An edit may increment the version number more than once, so Version should only be compared to a stored value.
Returns the version number of this object.
